page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Straddling the{Ealing-Hounslow {boundary}the area is bisected by {East-West transport routes.}Industry originally moved from the{Thames}to the{Great West Road}with ease of access to and from{London,}cheap land, cheap local female labour and the proximity of{Heathrow Airport}leading to light industry thriving. The{M4 accentuated Heathrow's importance and the resultant switch of land use to warehousing. The frequent{Piccadilly {tube line}service linking the area with Heathrow and Central London encouraged residential growth and resulted in a multi-ethnic population mix. The legacy of fine houses and parks are testimony to the time when the{centre of Ealing was within the {area}and to the{past importance of the {Thames and Brentford,}the County town of Middlesex.
